fields.title: Introduction to Python
fields.short_description: Learn Python from scratch. Variables, loops, functions, and more.
fields.description: This comprehensive course takes you from zero to confident Python programmer. You will learn variables, data types, control flow, functions, modules, file I/O, and object-oriented programming through hands-on projects.

fields.title: Django for Beginners
fields.short_description: Build real web applications with Django. Models, views, templates, and deployment.
fields.description: Django is the most popular Python web framework. In this course you will build several real-world web applications, learning models, migrations, views, templates, authentication, and how to deploy to production.

fields.title: PostgreSQL Fundamentals
fields.short_description: Master relational databases with PostgreSQL. SQL, indexes, and performance.
fields.description: This course covers relational database design, SQL queries from basic to advanced, indexing strategies, query optimization, transactions, and common patterns for production databases.

fields.title: Setting Up Your Environment
fields.content:
In this lesson we install Python 3.12 and set up a virtual environment.

Open your terminal and run:

  python -m venv venv
  source venv/bin/activate  # Windows: venv\Scripts\activate

You are now inside a virtual environment. All packages installed here are isolated from your system Python.

fields.title: Variables and Data Types
fields.content:
Python has dynamic typing â€” you don't declare types explicitly.

Common types:
- int: whole numbers (42)
- float: decimal numbers (3.14)
- str: text ('hello')
- bool: True or False
- list: ordered collection [1, 2, 3]
- dict: key-value pairs {'name': 'Alice'}

Assignment is simple: x = 10

fields.title: Functions and Modules
fields.content:
Functions let you encapsulate reusable logic.

def greet(name):
    return f'Hello, {name}!'

print(greet('World'))  # Hello, World!

Modules are Python files. Import them with: import math

fields.title: What is Django?
fields.content:
Django is a high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design. It follows the MTV (Model-Template-View) pattern.

Install it with: pip install Django

Create a project: django-admin startproject myproject .

fields.title: Models and Migrations
fields.content:
Django models are Python classes that map to database tables.

class Article(models.Model):
    title = models.CharField(max_length=255)
    body = models.TextField()
    created_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now_add=True)

Create the table: python manage.py makemigrations && python manage.py migrate

fields.title: Introduction to SQL
